problem_summary_simple: Build a new array where each element is derived from the input array based on its indices.
problem_summary_technical: Construct ans[i] = nums[nums[i]]. The in-place solution uses bit manipulation to store two values per element.
key_insights: The problem requires building a new array based on a mapping defined by the input array.
The in-place solution cleverly uses the fact that numbers are within the range [0, n-1] to encode original and new values.
The non-in-place solution is straightforward and uses O(n) extra space.
